MA-covid.png.description: A scatter plot showing the exponential growth of covid infections in MA
MA-covid.png.source: Created by the Bootstrap Team based on data from https://www.OurWorldInData.com/covid

MA-covid-flipped.png.description: A scatter plot showing the exponential growth of covid infections in MA, reflected over the line y=x
MA-covid-flipped.png.source: Created by the Bootstrap Team based on data from https://www.OurWorldInData.com/covid

wealth-health.png.description: A scatter plot showing the growth of median life expectancy as per-capital GDP increases
wealth-health.png.source: Created by the Bootstrap Team based on data from https://www.cia.gov

covid-graph.png.description: A graph showing the exponential rise in positive test cases in Massachusetts over time
covid-graph.png.source: Created in Desmos by the Bootstrap Team

inverse-covid-graph.png.description: A graph showing the exponential rise in positive test cases in Massachusetts over time, reflected across y=x to show the inverse, logarithmic relationship
inverse-covid-graph.png.source: Created in Desmos by the Bootstrap Team

difference-table-exponential-2.png.description: A table with columns for x (1,2,3,4,5) and y (2,4,8,16,32), arrows showing the factor by which each y-value value is multiplied (2,2,2,2) over a constant increase in x

difference-table-logarithmic.png.description: A table with columns for x (2,4,8,16,32) and y (1,2,3,4,5), arrows showing the factor by which each x-value value is multiplied (2,2,2,2) to get a constant increase in y

visual-distance.jpg.description: Two images. Top: The sky and land below, when see from an airplane window. The tip of the wing is also in view. Bottom: Railroad tracks stretching out into the distance, appearing to almost meet at the horizon.

chili.png.description: Railroad tracks stretching out into the distance, appearing to almost meet at the horizon

decibels-table.png.description: A table showing varying sound intensity levels (i.e., whisper, fortissimo, jet take-off) in watts per square meter and in decibels
